Question.Text: A 3-year-old boy presents to a clinic in Laos with a 10-day history of fever and poor appetite. He also has unilateral parotid swelling and purulent discharge from his ear.

Answer: Melioidosis with parotitis and mastoiditis - The patient presents with prolonged fever, unilateral parotid swelling, and purulent otorrhea in Laos, highly endemic for Burkholderia pseudomallei. The images show parotid abscess with ear discharge and bipolar-staining gram-negative bacilli (safety-pin appearance) characteristic of Burkholderia pseudomallei, an important tropical infection in Southeast Asia.
